US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Inva.title: US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Invade Again - Pentagon
US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Inva.summary:
US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Invade Again – PentagonThe United States wants Russia’s military capability weakened so that it cannot carry out another invasion, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Monday after returning from a trip to Kyiv.
“We want to see Russia weakened to the degree that it can’t do the kinds of things that it has done in invading Ukraine,” Austin told a group of journalists after he and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Ukrainian President Volodymyr ZelenskyAFP
US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Inva.text:
US Wants Russia Weaken So It Cannot Invade Again – Pentagon

The United States wants Russia’s military capability weakened so that it cannot carry out another invasion, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Monday after returning from a trip to Kyiv.

“We want to see Russia weakened to the degree that it can’t do the kinds of things that it has done in invading Ukraine,” Austin told a group of journalists after he and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky

AFP

N. Macedonia's Ading proposes higher div.title: N. Macedonia's Ading proposes higher dividend for 2021
N. Macedonia's Ading proposes higher div.summary:
SKOPJE (N. Macedonia), April 26 (SeeNews) - North Macedonia-based construction chemicals producer Ading [MSE:ADIN] said it plans to pay out a gross dividend of 30 denars ($0.52/0.49 euro) per share for last year, higher than the gross dividend of 27.78 denars distributed for 2020.
The company will distribute the dividend out of its 2021 net profit, it said in a bourse filing last week.
Ading booked a net profit of 22 million denars in 2021, up 12% compared with the year before.
Skopje-based Ading, established in 1969, has representative offices and distributors in 13 countries in Southeast Europe, Asia and the Middle East.
Outside North Macedonia, Ading has production facilities in Bulgaria.
N. Macedonia's Ading proposes higher div.text:
SKOPJE (N. Macedonia), April 26 (SeeNews) - North Macedonia-based construction chemicals producer Ading [MSE:ADIN] said it plans to pay out a gross dividend of 30 denars ($0.52/0.49 euro) per share for last year, higher than the gross dividend of 27.78 denars distributed for 2020.

The company will distribute the dividend out of its 2021 net profit, it said in a bourse filing last week.

Its shareholders will vote on the proposed dividend distribution at a meeting to be held on May 26.

Ading booked a net profit of 22 million denars in 2021, up 12% compared with the year before.

Ading's shares last traded on March 18 on the Macedonian Stock Exchange (MSE), at an average price of 760 denars.

Skopje-based Ading, established in 1969, has representative offices and distributors in 13 countries in Southeast Europe, Asia and the Middle East. Outside North Macedonia, Ading has production facilities in Bulgaria.

(1 euro = 61.54 denars)
